item.title: The Road to GA - Introduction
item.dc:creator: mminella
item.content:encoded:
As you all should be aware by now, the Spring portfolio is in the process of driving towards the next major versions to be released in November of this year. This will be only the fourth major generation for Spring Boot and the seventh major generation for Spring Framework in its over 20 year history. We are excited to bring you a great set of new features that builds on the current foundations.

While we are keeping the JDK baseline at JDK 17 because that is the industry consensus, we will upgrade to Jakarta EE 11 (Tomcat 11, Hibernate ORM 7, Hibernate Validator 9) and embrace other upgrades like Kotlin 2, Jackson 3, JUnit 6. Along with that, this round of majors contains a long list of interesting and exciting capabilities across the portfolio that you all have been asking for.

With that in mind, we want to spend some time making sure you are aware of these new capabilities. To do that, each week from now until Spring Boot 4.0 goes GA in November, we will have a weekly blog post about a new capability in the upcoming release. Some of the features we haven't really talked about much yet. Others, we already have blog posts introducing the topic and will revisit it to bring you the latest and greatest of where that capability will land in November. Below is the list of topics and when each blog post will be published. We will update this blog post as they are with links to them so be sure to bookmark this post and follow along!

Date Title
September 9, 2025 Core Spring Resilience Features: @ConcurrencyLimit, @Retryable, RetryTemplate
September 16, 2025 API Versioning in Spring
September 23, 2025 HTTP Service Client Enhancements
September 30, 2025 The state of HTTP clients in Spring
October 7, 2025 Introducing Jackson 3 support in Spring
October 14, 2025 Share Consumer - aka Kafka Queues in Spring Kafka
October 21, 2025 Modularizing Spring Boot
October 28, 2025 Progressive Authorization in Spring Security
November 4, 2025 Spring gRPC - a New Spring Boot Module
November 11, 2025 Null-Safe applications with Spring Boot 4
November 18, 2025 OpenTelemetry with Spring Boot
November 25, 2025 Ahead of Time Repositories (Part 2)

We are excited to turn this next page in Spring's history. Many parts of what is on the list above has been driven by you, our community. For that, we say Thank You! As a reminder, milestones with many of these new capabilities are already available via Maven Central so be sure to check them out and provide your feedback! Finally be sure to come back to this page each week and get the latest link to the next blog in the series!

item.title: This Week in Spring - September 2nd, 2025
item.dc:creator: joshlong
item.content:encoded:
Hi, Spring fans! Welcome to another installment of This Week in Spring! I'm in Frankfurt, awaiting my flight to the Java-tastic Javazone 2025 event where I'll be joined by the legendary James Ward to deliver an AI-focused look at the latest-and-greatest in Spring! And I'm still recovering from the delirious deluge that was SpringOne 2025! So much to do, and so little time in which to do it. Oh well let's dive right into it!

  • in last week's installment of A Bootiful Podcast, I talked to JobRunr founder Ronald Dehuysser
  • As always, I'm loving Rod Johnson's videos looking at comparing how to build AI agents with Spring AI-powered Embabel against other frameworks, and you should too
  • I love this look at the MCP protocol by our friend Siva
  • what is the best embedded web server for Spring Boot
  • this is really cool - a a mechanism to load configuration into Spring Boot using Dotenvx
  • I like this look at some of the amazing essential utility classes
  • a great thread looking at some of the latest-and-greatest in Spring Boot 4 and Spring Framework 6 by Loiane Groner
  • this Spring Boot tutorial was recently updated and that makes me happy
  • Andrew Fawcett gave a nice talk looking at building 12-factor applications with Spring Boot at Spring I/O 2025.
  • I'm now watching this video on how to "stream millions of responses instantly"

item.title: This Week in Spring - August 26th, 2025
item.dc:creator: joshlong
item.content:encoded:
Hi, Spring fans! Welcome to another installment of This Week in Spring! I'm writing this from the floor of SpringOne, live from lovely Las Vegas! As you can imagine, I've got to get back into it, so we'll make this one a quick one. And if you're here, be sure to say "hi"!

  • In last week's A Bootiful Podcast, I talked to Andrey Belyaev, product manager for IntelliJ IDEA
  • Good news everybody! Spring Boot 4.0.0.M2 is available
  • Spring Batch 6.0.0.M2 is available now
  • Spring Authorization Server 2.0.0 M2, 1.5.2, and 1.4.5 available now
  • Spring Modulith 2.0 M2, 1.4.3, and 1.3.9 released
  • Loiane Groner has a nice writeup on what's coming in Spring Boot 4 and Spring Framework 7
  • Docker, yes THE Docker, has a nice look at simplifying your Spring AI builds with Docker
  • I love me some Flyway! And here's a nice tutorial on using it with Spring Boot
  • It was nice to be on Spring Office Hourse recently
  • I love this! Finally a complex topic distilled into its simple components! CQRS with Spring Modulith
  • I love this blog series from Embabel (and Spring) founder Rod Johnson comparing his new Spring AI-powered agentic AI framework Embabel with popular agentic AI frameworks in the Python ecosystem. This latest post looks at CrewAI
  • Speaking of building with Spring AI: AWS had a nice workshop on just this very topic. Anybody know if it will be recorded and can be streamed?. Either way: register now!
  • A great talk, JSpecify: Java Nullness Annotations and Kotlin, by David Baker
